Description

RTAC: A Realtime Algorithm Configuration Methods Suite

This Software is a reimplementation of the realtime algorithm configurators (RAC) described in “ReACTR: Realtime Algorithm Configuration through Tournament Rankings” [2] (ReACTR), a light extension of ReACTR incorporating additional output at tournament end (ReACTR++), “Pool-Based Realtime Algorithm Configuration” [1] (CPPL) and “Realtime gray-box algorithm configuration using cost-sensitive classification” [3, 4] (gray-box RAC) into a collective RAC suite. It also includes extended options regarding logging, input, e.g. parameter space via PCS files, and target algorithm calls. It is possible to use the gray-box functioality with ReACTR, ReACTR++ and CPPL.

Additionally, the library is intended to encourage further research by being written in a way that facilitates the introduction of further RAC approaches. Pull requests at Github and reporting of bugs are welcome.

References

[1]

Adil El Mesaoudi-Paul, Dimitri Weiß, Viktor Bengs, Eyke Hüllermeier, and Kevin Tierney. Pool-based realtime algorithm configuration: a preselection bandit approach. In Ilias S. Kotsireas and Panos M. Pardalos, editors, Learning and Intelligent Optimization, 216–232. 2020.

[2]

Tadhg Fitzgerald, Yuri Malitsky, and Barry O'Sullivan. Reactr: realtime algorithm configuration through tournament rankings. In International Joint Conferences on Artificial Intelligence Organization (IJCAI), 304–310. 2015.

[3]

Dimitri Weiss and Kevin Tierney. Realtime gray-box algorithm configuration. In Dimitris E. Simos, Varvara A. Rasskazova, Francesco Archetti, Ilias S. Kotsireas, and Panos M. Pardalos, editors, Learning and Intelligent Optimization, 162–177. 2022.

[4]

Dimitri Weiss and Kevin Tierney. Realtime gray-box algorithm configuration using cost-sensitive classification. Annals of Mathematics and Artificial Intelligence, pages 1–22, 08 2023. doi:10.1007/s10472-023-09890-x.
